con:interface.name: Petstore Kafka - Pets
con:interface.con:description: A simple demo API based on a real implementation. This is part of a stack.

con:part.con:content:
asyncapi: '2.4.0' info: title: Petstore Kafka - Pets version: '1.0.0' description: | A simple demo API based on a real implementation. This is part of a stack. license: name: Apache 2.0 url: https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
servers: local: url: localhost:9092 protocol: kafka description: When running the dev stack. compose: url: kafka:9092 protocol: kafka description: When running within docker-compose
defaultContentType: application/json
channels: pets.added: description: Pets that are added publish: summary: New Pet added. operationId: addPet traits: - $ref: '#/components/operationTraits/kafka' message: description: New Pets payload: $ref: "https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/SwaggerPMTests/petstore-common/1.0.0#/components/schemas/NewPet"
pets.statusChanged: description: | Cache pet statuses to know if an adoption is possible. subscribe: summary: Pet's status has changed. operationId: cachePetStatus traits: - $ref: '#/components/operationTraits/kafka' message: description: New Pets payload: $ref: "https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/SwaggerPMTests/petstore-common/1.0.0#/components/schemas/PetStatusChange"
components: operationTraits: kafka: bindings: kafka: clientId: type: string

con:channel.name: pets.statusChanged
con:channel.con:description: Cache pet statuses to know if an adoption is possible.

con:interface.name: Pets and Adoption API
con:interface.con:description:
An API for tracking **Pets** and **Pet Adoptions** across our event and REST based petstore. This OpenAPI definition describes the RESTful APIs offered by the store.
Links: - [The code repository housing the implementation](https://github.com/swagger-api/petstore-kafka)
Other useful information related to this API:

con:method.name: getPets
con:method.con:description: A list of pets with information on their status and location

con:parameter.con:name: status
con:parameter.con:description: Status values that need to be considered for filter

con:parameter.con:name: location
con:parameter.con:description: the store location of the pet

con:method.name: postPet
con:method.con:description: Add a new pet to the store

con:method.name: patchPetStatus
con:method.con:description: Use this operation to update the adoption status of a pet

con:method.name: getAdoptions
con:method.con:description: A list of adoptions with information on their status and pet

con:parameter.con:name: status
con:parameter.con:description: Status values that need to be considered for filter

con:parameter.con:name: location
con:parameter.con:description: the store location of the pet adoption

con:method.name: postAdoption
con:method.con:description: Add a new pet to the store

con:method.name: patchAdoptionStatus
con:method.con:description: Use this operation to update the adoption status of an adoption

con:interface.name: Petstore Kafka - Adoptions
con:interface.con:description: A simple demo API based on a real implementation. This is part of a stack.

con:part.con:content:
asyncapi: '2.6.0' info: title: Petstore Kafka - Adoptions version: '1.0.0' description: | A simple demo API based on a real implementation. This is part of a stack. license: name: Apache 2.0 url: https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
servers: local: url: localhost:9092 protocol: kafka description: When running the dev stack. compose: url: kafka:9092 protocol: kafka description: When running within docker-compose
defaultContentType: application/json
channels: adoptions.requested: description: A new adoption was requested publish: summary: New Adoption. operationId: addAdoption traits: - $ref: '#/components/operationTraits/kafka' message: payload: $ref: "https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/SwaggerPMTests/petstore-common/1.0.0#/components/schemas/NewAdoption"
adoptions.statusChanged: description: The status of the Adoption has changed. subscribe: traits: - $ref: '#/components/operationTraits/kafka' message: description: Adoption status changed payload: $ref: "https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/SwaggerPMTests/petstore-common/1.0.0#/components/schemas/AdoptionStatusChanged" publish: traits: - $ref: '#/components/operationTraits/kafka' message: description: Adoption status changed payload: $ref: "https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/SwaggerPMTests/petstore-common/1.0.0#/components/schemas/AdoptionStatusChanged"
pets.statusChanged: description: The status of the Pet has changed. subscribe: summary: Pet's status has changed. operationId: changePetStatus traits: - $ref: '#/components/operationTraits/kafka' message: description: New Pets payload: $ref: "https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/SwaggerPMTests/petstore-common/1.0.0#/components/schemas/PetStatusChange"
components: operationTraits: kafka: bindings: kafka: clientId: type: string const: adoptions

con:channel.name: adoptions.statusChanged
con:channel.con:description: The status of the Adoption has changed.

con:channel.name: pets.statusChanged
con:channel.con:description: The status of the Pet has changed.

con:testSuite.name: (REST) - Pets and Adoptions API - Tests
con:testSuite.con:description: The test suite generated for the REST service [Pets and Adoption API]

con:testCase.name: /pets Test Case
con:testCase.con:description: The test case generated for the REST resource [/pets] located at [/pets]

con:testCase.name: /adoptions Test Case
con:testCase.con:description: The test case generated for the REST resource [/adoptions] located at [/adoptions]

con:restRequest.name: POST adoptions
con:restRequest.con:request: {\r "pets" : [ "${#[Pets and Adoptions API - Tests#/pets Test Case#POST pets]#Response#$['id']}" ],\r "location" : "${#[Pets and Adoptions API - Tests#/pets Test Case#POST pets]#Response#$['location']}"\r }

con:testSuite.name: (Multi-Protocol) - Add PET - Update status - Verify events

con:testCase.name: Update pet status and verify statusChanged event

con:elements.con:expectedValue: ${#[(Multi-Protocol) - Add PET - Update status - Verify events#Add Pet and verify event#POST pets]#Response#$['id']}

con:entry.value: ${#[(Multi-Protocol) - Add PET - Update status - Verify events#Add Pet and verify event#POST pets]#Response#$['id']}

con:testSuite.name: (Multi-protocol) - Adopt an available Pet - Verify events

con:eventHandlers.name: RequestFilter.filterRequest
TestRunListener.afterStep
